text:
“The Disinhibited Fascist” Edition
Donald Trump might be a fascist…but should we call him out on it?

Episode Notes
This week, Emily Bazelon, John Dickerson, and David Plotz discuss Donald Trump’s fascism, disinhibition, and age; the state of young men in America with [Rachel Simmons](https://rachelsimmons.com/); and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at the University of Michigan with [Nicholas Confessore](https://www.nytimes.com/by/nicholas-confessore) of The New York Times. Join us on December 4 for Political Gabfest Live in Brooklyn! [Tickets are on sale now](https://thebellhouseny.com/event/political-gabfest). And send us your Conundrums at [slate.com/conundrum](https://slate.com/conundrum).
Here are some notes and references from this week’s show:
[Ezra Klein for The New York Times Ezra Klein Show: ][What’s Wrong With Donald Trump?](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/22/opinion/donald-trump-ezra-klein-podcast.html); [Peter Baker, Dylan Freedman, Chevaz Clarke, and Aaron Byrd for The New York Times: ][Trump’s Speeches, Increasingly Angry and Rambling, Reignite the Question of Age](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/06/us/politics/trump-speeches-age-cognitive-decline.html); and [Michael S. Schmidt: ][As Election Nears, Kelly Warns Trump Would Rule Like a Dictator](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/22/us/politics/john-kelly-trump-fitness-character.html)
Jeffrey Goldberg for The Atlantic: [Trump: ‘I Need The Kind Of Generals That Hitler Had’](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2024/10/trump-military-generals-hitler/680327/)
ABC News: [Kamala Harris reacts to John Kelly’s remarks that Trump is a ‘fascist’](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4e9QMw1gqgE) and CNN: [Harris says she believes Trump is a fascist: Part 1 of Kamala Harris’ Town Hall](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dpuitnymSvk)
[Niall Stanage for The Hill: ][What we know, and what we don’t, about early voting numbers](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4947776-early-voting-2024-election-trends/)
[Odd Girl Out](https://www.amazon.com/Odd-Girl-Out-Culture-Aggression-ebook/dp/B003WJQ7CG/tag=slatmaga-20) by Rachel Simmons and [Girls Leadership](https://girlsleadership.org/)
[Men Without Work: Post-Pandemic Edition](https://www.amazon.com/Men-Without-Work-Post-Pandemic-Threats/dp/1599475979/tag=slatmaga-20) by Nicholas Eberstadt
Richard V. Reeves in Politico Magazine: [Opinion: Democrats’ Problem With Male Voters Isn’t Complicated](https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2024/10/17/harris-campaign-strategy-men-00184062) and Richard Reeves and Will Secker for American Institute for Boys and Men: [Degrees of Difference: Male College Enrollment and Completion](https://aibm.org/research/male-college-enrollment-and-completion/)
[Nicholas Confessore for The New York Times: ][The University of Michigan Doubled Down on D.E.I. What Went Wrong?](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/16/magazine/dei-university-michigan.html) and [Anna Betts: ][What to Know About State Laws That Limit or Ban D.E.I. Efforts at Colleges](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/04/21/us/dei-education-state-laws.html)
Here are this week’s chatters:
John: Niraj Chokshi for The New York Times: [‘No Smoking’ Signs on Planes Can Now Stay On Forever](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/22/business/no-smoking-sign-planes-faa.html) and CBS News: [New Zealand airport with 3-minute cap on farewell hugs “surprised how much global interest” there’s been](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/dunedin-airport-hugs-3-minute-limit-new-zealand-surprise-global-interest/)
Emily: Joshua Cohen for The New Yorker: [My Camp](https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2024/10/21/my-camp-fiction-joshua-cohen) and Clint Smith for The Atlantic: [How Do You Forgive The People Who Killed Your Family?](https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2024/11/genocide-rwanda-forgiveness-reconciliation/679948/)
David: Juliet Eilperin, Carolyn Van Houten, and Alice Li for The Washington Post: [What to Do About One of America’s Last Wild Places](https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/interactive/2024/arctic-national-wildlife-refuge-oil/)
Listener chatter from Aaron in Portland, Oregon: Clare Watson for Science Alert: [Swiss Startup Connects 16 Human Mini-Brains to Create Low Energy ‘Biocomputer’](https://www.sciencealert.com/swiss-startup-connects-16-human-mini-brains-to-create-low-energy-biocomputer)
For this week’s Slate Plus bonus episode, Emily, John, and David talk about Elon Musk following Donald Trump.
In the latest [Gabfest Reads](https://slate.com/podcasts/gabfestreads/2024/10/books-surviving-the-election-cycle-meditation-screaming-2024-10-percent-happier-author-interview-dan-harris), John talks with Dan Harris about his book, [10% Happier 10th Anniversary Edition: How I Tamed the Voice in My Head, Reduced Stress Without Losing My Edge, and Found Self-Help That Actually Works – A True Story](https://www.amazon.com/10-Happier-Revised-Self-Help-Works-ebook/dp/B07R4NMHJ2/tag=slatmaga-20).
